API Documentation¶

Below is the documentation for the main owpm API for development refrerence. This is different to the “developer” docs as they cover general maintainability notes whereas this is an api-specific section that is automatically generated.

owpm.py¶

The core module of owpm, used for everything apart from outside documentation/ build scripts in the scope of owpm.

owpm.BASE_PATH = PosixPath('/home/owen/.local/bin')¶

Path for virtual machines

exception owpm.ExceptionApiDown¶

When a seemingly correct API request to a package repo does not return status 200

exception owpm.ExceptionBadOs¶

When the user has an incompatible os

exception owpm.ExceptionOldLockfileSpec¶

When the lockfile version/specification is too new or old for owpm to recognise

exception owpm.ExceptionOwpmNotFound¶

When a detection function cannot find a .owpm file

exception owpm.ExceptionPackageNotFound¶

When a package could not be found inside of pypi/other package repos

exception owpm.ExceptionVenvInactive¶

When trying to modify a venv (from [OwpmVenv]) but it is inactive/does not exist

exception owpm.ExceptionVersionError¶

When a user gives a version of a package that is not avalible

class owpm.OwpmVenv(venv_pin: int = None, is_active: bool = False)¶

A built virtual enviroment created from a valid [Project]. If no venv_pin is given, it will generate a new one automatically

check_venv_hashes(packages: list) → bool¶

Checks a sqlite SELECT * FROM locks to locally installed hashes

create_venv()¶

Creates venv

delete()¶

Deletes venv if active

spawn_shell(args: list)¶

Creates an interactive shell and injects command base into

class owpm.Package(parent_proj: owpm.Project, name: str, version_req: str = '*', is_dev: bool = False, is_dep: bool = False, should_rem_hash: bool = True)¶

A single package when using owpm. save_hash is generated automatically after locking once. should_rem_hash is internal use on loading from .owpm files and is_dev defines if it is a development package or not

get_hash(package_resp: requests.models.Response) → str¶

Gets lock hash, package_resp is for modularity (use _pypi_req(“package”))

get_subpackages() → str¶

Scans pypi for dependancies and adds them to [Project.package] as a new [Package] and returns hash of this self

class owpm.Project(name: str, desc: str = 'No description', version: str = '0.1.0', lockfile_hash: str = '')¶

The overall project file. Name is the save name and lockfile_hash is for stopping mutliple locks on add -> install

build_proj(force_lock: bool = False, use_dev_deps: bool = True) → owpm.OwpmVenv¶

Returns an installed venv or installs packages from lock_path, locks if lockfile is out of date and adds to a new venv, which is then returned for user to remember

lock_proj(force_lock: bool = False) → bool¶

Locks all packages and package deps then saves to .owpmlock path; force always locks, even if owpm thinks the packages are already locked. Will return a False if it needed to lock or True if smart-locked

remove_packages(to_remove: list)¶

Removes a list of [Package] from .owpm

save_proj()¶

Creates a human-readable and editable save file

owpm.first_project_indir() → owpm.Project¶

Finds first .owpm file in running directory and returns [Project]

owpm.project_from_toml(owpm_path: pathlib.Path) → owpm.Project¶

Gets a [Project] from a given TOML path

owpm
